de.unisiegen.tpml.core
Interface ProofModel

All Superinterfaces:
Bean, TreeModel
All Known Subinterfaces:
InterpreterProofModel
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractInterpreterProofModel, AbstractProofModel, BigStepProofModel, SmallStepProofModel, TypeCheckerProofModel
public interface ProofModel
extends Bean, TreeModel

The interface defines a suitable data model for proving various properties about an expression. It is based on the generic TreeModel.

Version:
$Rev: 486 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
AbstractProofModel, ProofNode

Method Detail

isCheating

boolean isCheating()
Returns true if the user cheated during the prove using the guess(ProofNode) or complete(ProofNode) methods. Otherwise, if the user did the whole proof by hand, false will be returned.

Returns:
true if the user cheated, false otherwise.

isFinished

boolean isFinished()
Returns true if the proof is finished successfully, otherwise if either the proof is not yet completed or the proof got stuck, false will be returned.

Returns:
true if the proof is finished.

getLanguage

Language getLanguage()
Returns the Language for which this proof model was constructed.

Returns:
the Language for the proof model.
See Also:
Language, ProofRuleSet.getLanguage()

getRules

ProofRule[] getRules()
Returns the list of ProofRules that should be displayed as possible rules in the user interface. This is usually a subset of the list of all available rules for the given proof. The user interface should query the rules everytime the user opens the menu/list to apply rules, as the list of rules may have changed after an operation.

Returns:
the ProofRules to be displayed in the user interface.
See Also:
ProofRuleSet.getRules()

isRedoable

boolean isRedoable()
Returns true if the model has recorded undo steps that can be redone using the redo() operation.

Returns:
true if redo() is possible, false otherwise.
See Also:
isUndoable(), redo()

isUndoable

boolean isUndoable()
Returns true if the model has recorded proof steps that can be undone using the undo() operation.

Returns:
true if undo() is possible, false otherwise.
See Also:
isRedoable(), undo()

redo

void redo()
          throws CannotRedoException
Redoes the previously undo change to the proof model. Use isRedoable() to test whether there's a change to this model that can be redone.

Throws:
CannotRedoException - if the redo history is empty or the change cannot be redone for some other reason.
See Also:
undo()

undo

void undo()
          throws CannotUndoException
Undoes the previous change to the proof model. Use isUndoable() to test whether there's a change to this model that can be undone.

Throws:
CannotUndoException - if the undo history is empty or the change cannot be undone for some other reason.
See Also:
redo()

complete

void complete(ProofNode node)
              throws ProofGuessException
Completes the sub tree starting at the given node using incremental guessing. The method is somewhat smart in detecting diversion in the big step interpreter.

Parameters:
node - the ProofNode which to complete.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the node is invalid for this model.
IllegalStateException - if for some reason node cannot be proven.
NullPointerException - if node is null.
ProofGuessException
See Also:
guess(ProofNode)

guess

void guess(ProofNode node)
           throws ProofGuessException
Guesses the next proof step for the specified node. The node must not be already proven (see the ProofNode.isProven() method for details), otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Parameters:
node - the ProofNode for which the next proof step should be guessed.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the node is invalid for this model.
IllegalStateException - if for some reason node cannot be proven.
NullPointerException - if node is null.
ProofGuessException - if the next proof step could not be guessed.
See Also:
complete(ProofNode), prove(ProofRule, ProofNode)

prove

void prove(ProofRule rule,
           ProofNode node)
           throws ProofRuleException
Applies the given proof rule to the specified proof node. The node must not be already proven (see the ProofNode.isProven() method for details), otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Parameters:
rule - the ProofRule to apply.
node - the ProofNode to which the rule should be applied.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if for some reason node cannot be proven.
ProofRuleException
See Also:
guess(ProofNode)

containsSyntacticSugar

boolean containsSyntacticSugar(ProofNode node,
                               boolean recursive)
Returns true if the expression for the node contains syntactic sugar. If recursive is true and the expression for the node is not syntactic sugar, its sub expressions will also be checked.

Parameters:
node - the proof node whose expression should be checked for syntactic sugar.
Returns:
true if the expression of the node contains syntactic sugar according to the language for this model.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the node is invalid for this proof model.
NullPointerException - if the node is null.
See Also:
translateToCoreSyntax(ProofNode, boolean), LanguageTranslator.containsSyntacticSugar(Expression, boolean)

translateToCoreSyntax

void translateToCoreSyntax(ProofNode node,
                           boolean recursive)
Translates the expression for the node to core syntax according to the language for this model. If recursive is true, all sub expressions will also be translated to core syntax, otherwise only the outermost expression will be translated.

Parameters:
node - the proof node whose expression should be translated to core syntax.
recursive - whether to translate the expression recursively.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the node is invalid for this proof model, or the node's expression does not contain syntactic sugar.
IllegalStateException - if any steps were performed on the node already.
NullPointerException - if the node is null.
See Also:
containsSyntacticSugar(ProofNode, boolean), LanguageTranslator.translateToCoreSyntax(Expression, boolean)

getRoot

ProofNode getRoot()
Returns the root of the tree. Returns null only if the tree has no nodes.

Specified by:
getRoot in interface TreeModel
Returns:
the root of the proof tree.
See Also:
TreeModel.getRoot()

getChild

ProofNode getChild(Object parent,
                   int index)
Returns the child of parent at index index in the parent's child array. parent must be a node previously obtained from this data source. This should not return null if index is a valid index for parent (that is index >= 0 && index < getChildCount(parent)).

Specified by:
getChild in interface TreeModel
Parameters:
parent - a node in the tree, obtained from this data source.
index - the child index of a child node of parent.
Returns:
the child of parent at index index.
See Also:
TreeModel.getChild(java.lang.Object, int)

getPathToRoot

TreeNode[] getPathToRoot(TreeNode aNode)
Builds the parents of node up to and including the root node, where the original node is the last element in the returned array. The length of the returned array gives the node's depth in the tree.

Parameters:
aNode - the TreeNode to get the path for.
Returns:
the parents of aNode up to and including the root node.

getTreeModelListeners

TreeModelListener[] getTreeModelListeners()
Returns an array of all the tree model listeners registered on this model.

Returns:
all of this model's TreeModelListener's or an empty array if no tree model listeners are currently registered.
See Also:
TreeModel.addTreeModelListener(TreeModelListener), TreeModel.removeTreeModelListener(TreeModelListener)

getListeners

<T extends EventListener> T[] getListeners(Class<T> listenerType)
Returns an array of all the objects currently registered as FooListeners upon this model. FooListeners are registered using the addFooListener method. You can specify the listenerType argument with a class literal, such as FooListener.class. For example, you can query a ProofModel m for its tree model listeners with the following code: 
TreeModelListener[] tmls = (TreeModelListener[])(m.getListeners(TreeModelListener.class));
If no such listeners exist, this method returns an empty array.

Parameters:
listenerType - the type of listeners requested; this parameter should specify an interface that descends from EventListener.
Returns:
an array of all objects registered as FooListeners on this prover, or an empty array if no such listeners have been added.
Throws:
ClassCastException - if listenerType doesn't specify a class or interface that implements EventListener.
See Also:
getTreeModelListeners()
